amendatorysection.catchline: Retailer licensee; annual statement; inspection; fee; department; composite report.
amendatorysection.para: (1) Within thirty days following the expiration of each license, each retailer licensee shall submit on a form furnished and approved by the department an annual statement setting forth, by county name, the number of net tons of each agricultural liming material sold by him or her for use in this state during the previous twelve-month period. Such statement shall be accompanied by payment of an inspection fee at the rate fixed by the director but not exceeding ten cents per ton. The fee shall be set at an amount to cover the expenses of the inspection provided in section 2-4325 and the costs of administering this section. The fee shall be paid by the retailer licensee and in the case of agricultural lime slurry, the fee shall be paid on the base lime material only.

(2) The department shall publish and make available, to each agricultural liming material registrant or licensee and to any other interested person upon his or her request, a composite report showing the tons of agricultural liming material sold in each county in this state. Such report shall in no way divulge the operation of any registrant or licensee.
